goal.en:
LIMITED TO ENGLISH FRESHMEN. 
This course was specifically designed for English 
Freshmen. If you are not a first-year student majoring in 
English, you will not be allowed to enroll. 

Overview: This theory and practice-course based seeks to 
provide students with basic critical thinking skills to assess
visual content in written form.

outline.en:
ALL COURSE CONTENT WILL BE PROVIDED IN
ENGLISH.
For the writing content, we will pay attention to
discussions related to the themes of (i) photography and
(ii) documentary film.

textbook.en:
Main references: 

* Barthes, Roland, 1981, Camera Lucida, Hill and Wang. 

* Trachtenberg, Alan, 1980, Classic Essays on 
Photography, Leete‘s Island Books. 

* Aufderheide, Patricia, 2007, Documentary Film. A Very 
Short Introduction, New York: Oxford University Press.

Course handouts and references will be ready to be
photocopied on the first week of classes.

gradMethod.en:
ATTENDING THE FIRST CLASS IS 
MANDATORY.

WORK FOR THE COURSE: 
Weekly Attendance: 20％ 
[With more than two absences, 
the student will automatically fail the course. Please, 
bear this in mind.]
Weekly Classroom Exercises: 20％ 
Midterm Essay: 30％
Final essay: 30％

officeHour.en: By appointment on Tuesday from 4 to 5 pm.
